snippet: The government of President Juan Manuel Santos said preliminary negotiations were underway with the National Liberation Army, a guerrilla group.
abstract: Colombian government begins exploratory peace talks with the National Liberation Army; move follows similar talks with larger rebel group FARC that began in 2012; decision comes just days ahead of a hotly contested presidential election that could hinge on how voters perceive the efforts of Pres Juan Manuel Santos to end decades of guerrilla warfare.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: The government of President Juan Manuel Santos said preliminary negotiations were underway with the National Liberation Army, a guerrilla group.

headline.main: Colombia Says It Has Begun Peace Talks With Rebels
headline.print_headline: Colombia Says It Has Begun Peace Talks With Rebels
